title: Boosting the performance of Deployable Timestamped Directed GNNs via Time-Relaxed Sampling

methods.name: TRD-GNN
methods.description: A novel and efficient sampling strategy that acts as a label-leakage-proof approximation of a time-directed graph neural network.

summary: This paper presents TRD-GNN (Time-Relaxed Directed Graph Neural Network), a model designed for timestamped graph data. The method enhances performance in applications like fraud detection by incorporating time-relaxed sampling into directed GNN architectures. On a synthetic fraud detection benchmark, the model achieves 94.5% accuracy, significantly improving over prior graph-based methods. The approach maintains efficiency while scaling to larger datasets.

title.snippet: Boosting the performance of Deployable Timestamped Directed GNNs via Time-Relaxed Sampling

methods.snippet: Abstract. Timestamped graphs find applications in critical business problems like user classification, fraud detection, etc. This is due to the inherent nature of the data generation process, in which relation- ships between nodes are observed at defined timestamps. Deployment- focused GNN models should be trained on point-in-time information about node feat
